oauth2.description:
We require that applications designed to access the Asana API on behalf of multiple users implement OAuth 2.0.
Asana supports the Authorization Code Grant flow.

scopes.default: Provides access to all endpoints documented in our API reference. If no scopes are requested, this scope is assumed by default.
scopes.email: Provides access to the user’s email through the OpenID Connect user info endpoint.
scopes.openid: Provides access to OpenID Connect ID tokens and the OpenID Connect user info endpoint.
scopes.profile: Provides access to the user’s name and profile photo through the OpenID Connect user info endpoint.

personalAccessToken.description: A personal access token allows access to the api for the user who created it. This should be kept a secret and be treated like a password.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description:
Results per page.
The number of objects to return per page. The value must be between 1 and 100.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description:
Offset token.
An offset to the next page returned by the API. A pagination request will return an offset token, which can be used as an input parameter to the next request. If an offset is not passed in, the API will return the first page of results.
'Note: You can only pass in an offset that was returned to you via a previously paginated request.'

parameters.name: parent
parameters.description: Globally unique identifier for object to fetch statuses from. Must be a GID for a `project`, `project_brief`, or `task`.

responses.description:
Sadly, sometimes requests to the API are not successful. Failures can
occur for a wide range of reasons. In all cases, the API should return
an HTTP Status Code that indicates the nature of the failure,
with a response body in JSON format containing additional information.


In the event of a server error the response body will contain an error
phrase. These phrases are automatically generated using the
[node-asana-phrase
library](https://github.com/Asana/node-asana-phrase) and can be used by
Asana support to quickly look up the incident that caused the server
error.

parameters.name: optPretty
parameters.description:
Provides “pretty” output.
Provides the response in a “pretty” format. In the case of JSON this means doing proper line breaking and indentation to make it readable. This will take extra time and increase the response size so it is advisable only to use this during debugging.

parameters.name: optFields
parameters.description:
Defines fields to return.
Some requests return *compact* representations of objects in order to conserve resources and complete the request more efficiently. Other times requests return more information than you may need. This option allows you to list the exact set of fields that the API should be sure to return for the objects. The field names should be provided as paths, described below.
The id of included objects will always be returned, regardless of the field options.

parameters.name: supportedGoal
parameters.description: Globally unique identifier for the supported goal in the goal relationship.

parameters.name: resourceSubtype
parameters.description: If provided, filter to goal relationships with a given resource_subtype.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description:
Results per page.
The number of objects to return per page. The value must be between 1 and 100.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description:
Offset token.
An offset to the next page returned by the API. A pagination request will return an offset token, which can be used as an input parameter to the next request. If an offset is not passed in, the API will return the first page of results.
'Note: You can only pass in an offset that was returned to you via a previously paginated request.'

parameters.name: workspace
parameters.description: The workspace or organization to filter portfolios on.

parameters.name: owner
parameters.description: The user who owns the portfolio. Currently, API users can only get a list of portfolios that they themselves own.

parameters.name: projectGid
parameters.description: Globally unique identifier for the project.

parameters.name: optPretty
parameters.description:
Provides “pretty” output.
Provides the response in a “pretty” format. In the case of JSON this means doing proper line breaking and indentation to make it readable. This will take extra time and increase the response size so it is advisable only to use this during debugging.

parameters.name: optFields
parameters.description:
Defines fields to return.
Some requests return *compact* representations of objects in order to conserve resources and complete the request more efficiently. Other times requests return more information than you may need. This option allows you to list the exact set of fields that the API should be sure to return for the objects. The field names should be provided as paths, described below.
The id of included objects will always be returned, regardless of the field options.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description:
Results per page.
The number of objects to return per page. The value must be between 1 and 100.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description:
Offset token.
An offset to the next page returned by the API. A pagination request will return an offset token, which can be used as an input parameter to the next request. If an offset is not passed in, the API will return the first page of results.
'Note: You can only pass in an offset that was returned to you via a previously paginated request.'

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description:
Results per page.
The number of objects to return per page. The value must be between 1 and 100.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description:
Offset token.
An offset to the next page returned by the API. A pagination request will return an offset token, which can be used as an input parameter to the next request. If an offset is not passed in, the API will return the first page of results.
'Note: You can only pass in an offset that was returned to you via a previously paginated request.'

methods.description: Get status updates from an object

parameters.name: parent
parameters.description: Globally unique identifier for object to fetch statuses from. Must be a GID for a project, portfolio, or goal.

parameters.name: createdSince
parameters.description: Only return statuses that have been created since the given time.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description:
Results per page.
The number of objects to return per page. The value must be between 1 and 100.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description:
Offset token.
An offset to the next page returned by the API. A pagination request will return an offset token, which can be used as an input parameter to the next request. If an offset is not passed in, the API will return the first page of results.
'Note: You can only pass in an offset that was returned to you via a previously paginated request.'

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description:
Results per page.
The number of objects to return per page. The value must be between 1 and 100.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description:
Offset token.
An offset to the next page returned by the API. A pagination request will return an offset token, which can be used as an input parameter to the next request. If an offset is not passed in, the API will return the first page of results.
'Note: You can only pass in an offset that was returned to you via a previously paginated request.'

parameters.name: assignee
parameters.description:
The assignee to filter tasks on. If searching for unassigned tasks, assignee.any = null can be specified.
*Note: If you specify `assignee`, you must also specify the `workspace` to filter on.*

parameters.name: project
parameters.description: The project to filter tasks on.

parameters.name: section
parameters.description:
The section to filter tasks on.
*Note: Currently, this is only supported in board views.*

parameters.name: workspace
parameters.description:
The workspace to filter tasks on.
*Note: If you specify `workspace`, you must also specify the `assignee` to filter on.*

parameters.name: completedSince
parameters.description: Only return tasks that are either incomplete or that have been completed since this time.

parameters.name: modifiedSince
parameters.description:
Only return tasks that have been modified since the given time.

*Note: A task is considered “modified” if any of its properties
change, or associations between it and other objects are modified
(e.g.  a task being added to a project). A task is not considered
modified just because another object it is associated with (e.g. a
subtask) is modified. Actions that count as modifying the task
include assigning, renaming, completing, and adding stories.*

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description:

'Note: You can only pass in an offset that was returned to you via a previously paginated request.'

parameters.name: team
parameters.description: Globally unique identifier for the team.

parameters.name: user
parameters.description: A string identifying a user. This can either be the string "me", an email, or the gid of a user. This parameter must be used with the workspace parameter.

parameters.name: workspace
parameters.description: Globally unique identifier for the workspace. This parameter must be used with the user parameter.

parameters.description:
Results per page.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description:
Offset token.
An offset to the next page returned by the API. A pagination request will return an offset token, which can be used as an input parameter to the next request. If an offset is not passed in, the API will return the first page of results.
'Note: You can only pass in an offset that was returned to you via a previously paginated request.'

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description:
Results per page.
The number of objects to return per page. The value must be between 1 and 100.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description:
Offset token.
An offset to the next page returned by the API. A pagination request will return an offset token, which can be used as an input parameter to the next request. If an offset is not passed in, the API will return the first page of results.
'Note: You can only pass in an offset that was returned to you via a previously paginated request.'

methods.description: Get all projects in a workspace

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description:
Results per page.
The number of objects to return per page. The value must be between 1 and 100.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description:
Offset token.
An offset to the next page returned by the API. A pagination request will return an offset token, which can be used as an input parameter to the next request. If an offset is not passed in, the API will return the first page of results.
'Note: You can only pass in an offset that was returned to you via a previously paginated request.'

parameters.name: archived
parameters.description: Only return projects whose `archived` field takes on the value of this parameter.
